rspStmt.AuthEnty: NSD - Norwegian Centre for Research Data

Core Scientific Team, consisting of: Rory Fitzgerald (PI and Director, ESS ERIC), Sarah Butt, Eric Harrison, Lorna Ryan, Salima Douhou, Luca Salini and Niccolò Ghirelli: ESS ERIC Headquarters at City, University of London, UK. Geert Loosveldt and Celine Wuyts: Katholieke Universiteit Leuven (KU Leuven), Belgium. NSD - Norwegian Centre for Research Data, Norway. Angelika Scheuer, Achim Koch, Verena Halbherr, Brita Dorer, Roberto Briceño-Rosas and Jan-Lucas Schanze: GESIS, Germany. Wiebke Weber, Diana Zavala Rojas, Melanie Revilla, Anna de Castellarnau and Hannah Schwarz: Universitat Pompeu Fabra, Spain. Ineke Stoop, Joost Kappelhof and Sander Steijn: The Netherlands Institute for Social Research (SCP), Netherlands. Brina Malnar: University of Ljubljana, Slovenia. Peter Lynn: University of Essex, United Kingdom.

othId.p: The following groups of people were involved in substantive or advisory capacities at various stages of the project: The ESS ERIC General Assembly, chaired by Michael Breen. The ESS ERIC Finance Committee, chaired by Joe Ellery. The Scientific Advisory Board, chaired by Piet Bracke. The Methods Advisory Board, chaired by Patrick Sturgis. The ESS ERIC Research Ethics Committee, chaired by Julie de Jong. The Sampling and Weighting Expert Panel, headed by Peter Lynn, University of Essex. The Translation Expert Panel, headed by Brita Dorer, GESIS. Expert on international education classification, Silke Schneider, GESIS. Experts on ancestry classification, Anthony Heath, University of Oxford, and Silke Schneider, GESIS. Questionnaire Design Team on Justice and Fairness in Europe, headed by Stefan Liebig, DIW Berlin/Freie Universität Berlin, Germany. Questionnaire Design Team on the Timing of Life, headed by Francesco Billari, Bocconi University, Italy. Expert papers on topics for the core questionnaire produced by John Curtice, Robert Eriksson, Jan O. Jonsson, Ken Newton, Shalom Schwartz, Jacques Thomassen and Joachim Vogel.

citation.biblCit: European Social Survey (2019). ESS Round 9 (2018/2019) Technical Report. London: ESS ERIC

subject.topcClas: timing of key life events and the life course
distributive and procedural justice and fairness

stdyInfo.abstract:
The European Social Survey (ESS) is an academically-driven multi-country survey, which has been administered in over 35 countries to date. Its three aims are, firstly – to monitor and interpret changing public attitudes and values within Europe and to investigate how they interact with Europe's changing institutions, secondly – to advance and consolidate improved methods of cross-national survey measurement in Europe and beyond, and thirdly – to develop a series of European social indicators, including attitudinal indicators.
In the ninth round, the survey covers 30 countries and employs the most rigorous methodologies. From Round 7 it is funded by the Members, Observers and Guests of ESS European Research Infrastructure Consortium (ESS ERIC) who represent national governments. Participating countries directly fund the central coordination costs of the ESS ERIC, as well the costs of fieldwork and national coordination in their own country.
The survey involves strict random probability sampling, a minimum target response rate of 70% and rigorous translation protocols. The hour-long face-to-face interview includes questions on a variety of core topics repeated from previous rounds of the survey and also two modules developed for Round 9 covering Justice and Fairness in Europe, and the Timing of Life (the latter is a partial repeat of a module from Round 3).

dataColl.weight:
DESIGN WEIGHTS: The purpose of the design weights (DWEIGHT) is to correct for unequal probabilities for selection due to the sampling design used. In general design weights were computed for each country as follows.
1.w = 1/(PROB1*...*PROBk) is a nx1 vector of weights ; k depends on the number of stages of the sampling design.
2. All weights were rescaled in a way that the sum of the final weights equals n, i.e. Rescaled weights = n*w/sum(w).
POST-STRATIFICATION WEIGHTS: The purpose of the post-stratified design weights (PSPWGHT) is to reduce sampling error and non-response bias, using auxiliary information. The post-stratification targets use information about age, gender, education and region. Raking (iterative proportional fitting) has been used in the production of the post-stratified weights, using the ipfweight procedure in Stata v15. For most countries population targets are weighted estimates from the European Union Labour Force Survey 2018 (Eurostat). Exceptions are Republic of Serbia, and Montenegro, for which targets were obtained from the respective national statistical office websites.
ANALYSIS WEIGHTS: The analysis weight (ANWEIGHT) corrects for population size when combining two or more countries' data, and is calculated as ANWEIGHT=PSPWGHT*PWEIGHT. When analysing data from a single country, or comparing countries, use of ANWEIGHT or PSPWGHT should give identical results.
POPULATION SIZE WEIGHTS: The Population size weight (PWEIGHT) corrects for population size when combining two or more country's data, and is calculated as PWEIGHT=[Population aged 15 years and over]/[(Net sample in data file)*10 000] Source population figures: Eurostat.

fileTxt.fileCont: Data from the Main questionnaire. See Appendix A7 Codebook.
fileTxt.dataChck: The data file is checked for: duplication of ID numbers, variable names and formats, empty records, wild codes and logical inconsistencies. Missing values have been assigned.
fileTxt.dataMsng: The following missing values have been assigned: 6, 66 etc. = Not applicable 7, 77 etc. = Refusal 8, 88 etc. = Don't know 9, 99 etc. = No answer, i.e. Missing data not elsewhere explained . = Variable not relevant, not deposited, or for other reason omitted from the data file by the archive.

qstn.qstnLit: A2 People can use the internet on different devices such as computers, tablets and smartphones. How often do you use the internet on these or any other devices, whether for work or personal use?

qstn.preQTxt: ASK IF MOST DAYS OR EVERY DAY AT A2 (code 4 or 5)
qstn.qstnLit: A3 On a typical day, about how much time do you spend using the internet on a computer, tablet, smartphone or other device, whether for work or personal use?
qstn.postQTxt: Please give your answer in hours and minutes. INTERVIEWER: TYPE IN DURATION

var.name: ppltrst
var.labl: Most people can be trusted or you can't be too careful

qstn.qstnLit: A4 Using this card, generally speaking, would you say that most people can be trusted, or that you can't be too careful in dealing with people? Please tell me on a score of 0 to 10, where 0 means you can't be too careful and 10 means that most people can be trusted.

var.name: pplfair
var.labl: Most people try to take advantage of you, or try to be fair

qstn.qstnLit: A5 Using this card, do you think that most people would try to take advantage of you if they got the chance, or would they try to be fair?

catgry.labl: Most people try to take advantage of me
Most people try to be fair

var.name: pplhlp
var.labl: Most of the time people helpful or mostly looking out for themselves

qstn.qstnLit: A6 Would you say that most of the time people try to be helpful or that they are mostly looking out for themselves?

catgry.labl: People mostly look out for themselves
People mostly try to be helpful

var.name: polintr
var.labl: How interested in politics

qstn.qstnLit: B1 How interested would you say you are in politics - are you...

var.notes: INTRODUCTION TO QUESTIONS B1-43: Now we want to ask a few questions about politics and government.

var.name: psppsgva
var.labl: Political system allows people to have a say in what government does

qstn.qstnLit: B2 How much would you say the political system in [country] allows people like you to have a say in what the government does?

var.name: actrolga
var.labl: Able to take active role in political group

qstn.qstnLit: B3 How able do you think you are to take an active role in a group involved with political issues?

var.name: psppipla
var.labl: Political system allows people to have influence on politics

qstn.qstnLit: B4 And how much would you say that the political system in [country] allows people like you to have an influence on politics?

var.name: cptppola
var.labl: Confident in own ability to participate in politics

qstn.qstnLit: B5 And how confident are you in your own ability to participate in politics?

var.name: trstprl
var.labl: Trust in country's parliament

qstn.qstnLit: B6-12 Using this card, please tell me on a score of 0-10 how much you personally trust each of the institutions I read out. 0 means you do not trust an institution at all, and 10 means you have complete trust. Firstly... ...[country]'s parliament?

qstn.qstnLit: B41 Would you say it is generally bad or good for [country]'s economy that people come to live here from other countries?

var.name: imueclt
var.labl: Country's cultural life undermined or enriched by immigrants

qstn.qstnLit: B42 And, using this card, would you say that [country]'s cultural life is generally undermined or enriched by people coming to live here from other countries?

var.name: imwbcnt
var.labl: Immigrants make country worse or better place to live

qstn.qstnLit: B43 Is [country] made a worse or a better place to live by people coming to live here from other countries?

var.name: happy
var.labl: How happy are you

qstn.qstnLit: C1 Taking all things together, how happy would you say you are?

var.notes: INTRODUCTION TO QUESTIONS C1-30: And now a few questions about you and your life.

var.name: sclmeet
var.labl: How often socially meet with friends, relatives or colleagues

qstn.qstnLit: C2 Using this card, how often do you meet socially with friends, relatives or work colleagues?

var.name: inprdsc
var.labl: How many people with whom you can discuss intimate and personal matters

qstn.qstnLit: C3 How many people, if any, are there with whom you can discuss intimate and personal matters?
qstn.postQTxt: Choose your answer from this card.

var.name: sclact
var.labl: Take part in social activities compared to others of same age

qstn.qstnLit: C4 Compared to other people of your age, how often would you say you take part in social activities?

var.name: crmvct
var.labl: Respondent or household member victim of burglary/assault last 5 years

qstn.qstnLit: C5 Have you or a member of your household been the victim of a burglary or assault in the last 5 years?

var.name: aesfdrk
var.labl: Feeling of safety of walking alone in local area after dark

qstn.qstnLit: C6 How safe do you - or would you - feel walking alone in this area after dark? Do - or would - you feel...

var.name: health
var.labl: Subjective general health

qstn.qstnLit: C7 How is your health in general? Would you say it is ...

var.notes: INTRODUCTION TO QUESTIONS C7-30: The next set of questions are about yourself.

var.name: hlthhmp
var.labl: Hampered in daily activities by illness/disability/infirmity/mental problem

qstn.qstnLit: C8 Are you hampered in your daily activities in any way by any longstanding illness, or disability, infirmity or mental health problem? If yes, is that a lot or to some extent?

var.name: atchctr
var.labl: How emotionally attached to [country]

qstn.qstnLit: C9 How emotionally attached do you feel to [country]? Please choose a number from 0 to 10, where 0 means not at all emotionally attached and 10 means very emotionally attached.
qstn.postQTxt: INTRODUCTION TO QUESTIONS C9-10: People might feel different levels of attachment to the country where they live and to Europe.

var.name: atcherp
var.labl: How emotionally attached to Europe

qstn.qstnLit: C10 And how emotionally attached do you feel to Europe?

var.name: lvpntyr

qstn.qstnLit: D3 In what year, if ever, did you first leave your parent(s) for 2 months or more to start living separately from them?
qstn.postQTxt: INTERVIEWER: Parents includes any legal guardian, such as foster, step and adoptive parents. Living separately means living in separate accommodation, i.e. with a separate entrance. Include students who live separately for 2 months or more even if they return to live with parents occasionally. TYPE IN YEAR

var.name: ageadlt
var.labl: Age become adults. SPLIT BALLOT

qstn.qstnLit: D15a/b People differ in their ideas about the ages at which girls/boys or women/men become adults, middle-aged and old. At what age, approximately, would you say girls/boys or women/men become adults?
qstn.postQTxt: INTERVIEWER: If respondent states 'It depends' accept answer and do NOT probe. If respondent provides an age range, ask for a specific age within that range. If respondent cannot give specific age, code as 'Don't know'. TYPE IN AGE

var.notes: INTRODUCTION TO QUESTIONS D15a/b-D34a/b: I I am now going to ask you some questions about girls and women while other people answering the survey will be asked about boys and men.

var.name: agemage
var.labl: Age reach middle age. SPLIT BALLOT

qstn.qstnLit: D16a/b And at what age, approximately, would you say women/men reach middle age?
qstn.postQTxt: INTERVIEWER: If respondent states 'It depends' accept answer and do NOT probe. If respondent provides an age range, ask for a specific age within that range. If respondent cannot give specific age, code as 'Don't know'. TYPE IN AGE

var.name: ageoage
var.labl: Age reach old age. SPLIT BALLOT

qstn.qstnLit: D17a/b And at what age, approximately, would you say women/men reach old age?
qstn.postQTxt: INTERVIEWER: If respondent states 'It depends' accept answer and do NOT probe. If respondent provides an age range, ask for a specific age within that range. If respondent cannot give specific age, code as 'Don't know'. TYPE IN AGE

var.name: iaglptn
var.labl: Start living with partner not married to, ideal age. SPLIT BALLOT

qstn.qstnLit: D18a/b In your opinion, what is the ideal age for a girl/boy or woman/man to start living with a partner she/he is not married to?
qstn.postQTxt: INTERVIEWER: If respondent states 'No ideal age' accept answer and do NOT probe. If respondent provides an age range, ask for a specific age within that range. If respondent cannot give specific age, code as 'Don't know'. TYPE IN AGE

catgry.labl: Should never live with partner not married to

var.notes: INTRODUCTION TO QUESTIONS D18a/b-D21a/b: We are now going to ask you a series of questions about the ideal age for girls/boys or women/men to do certain things, then about when they are too young and finally about when they are too old to do certain things. In each case please give an approximate age.

qstn.postQTxt: INTERVIEWER: If respondent states 'No ideal age' accept answer and do NOT probe. If respondent provides an age range, ask for a specific age within that range. If respondent cannot give specific age, code as 'Don't know'. TYPE IN AGE

ISCED 5A long, master/equivalent from upper/single tier tertiary

Ensino superior universitário: licenciatura com mais de 4 anos curriculares; licenciatura bietápica de 5 anos

var.name: frprtpl
var.labl: Political system in country ensures everyone fair chance to participate in politics

qstn.qstnLit: G1 How much would you say that the political system in [country] ensures that everyone has a fair chance to participate in politics?

var.notes: INTRODUCTION TO QUESTIONS G1-3: Now some questions on how the political system works in [country].

var.name: gvintcz
var.labl: Government in country takes into account the interests of all citizens

qstn.qstnLit: G2 How much would you say that the government in [country] takes into account the interests of all citizens?

var.name: poltran
var.labl: Decisions in country politics are transparent

qstn.qstnLit: G3 How much would you say that decisions in [country] politics are transparent, meaning that everyone can see how they were made?

var.name: ifredu
var.labl: Compared other people in country, fair chance achieve level of education I seek

qstn.preQTxt: To what extent do you think this statement applies to you? CARD 55
qstn.qstnLit: G4 Compared to other people in [country], I have had a fair chance of achieving the level of education I was seeking.

catgry.labl: I have not completed a level of education yet

var.notes: INTRODUCTION TO QUESTIONS G4-7: The next few questions are about access to education and job opportunities.

var.name: ifrjob
var.labl: Compared other people in country, fair chance get job I seek

qstn.preQTxt: Imagine you were looking for a job today. To what extent do you think this statement would apply to you? STILL CARD 55
qstn.qstnLit: G5 Compared to other people in [country], I would have a fair chance of getting the job I was seeking.

var.name: evfredu
var.labl: Everyone in country fair chance achieve level of education they seek

qstn.preQTxt: To what extent do you think this statement applies in [country]? STILL CARD 55
qstn.qstnLit: G6 Overall, everyone in [country] has a fair chance of achieving the level of education they seek.

var.name: evfrjob
var.labl: Everyone in country fair chance get job they seek

qstn.preQTxt: To what extent do you think this statement applies in [country]? STILL CARD 55
qstn.qstnLit: G7 Overall, everyone in [country] has a fair chance of getting the jobs they seek.

var.name: fvgabc
var.labl: Filter variable: ask about pay, pensions, or social benefits

qstn.qstnLit: G8 Filter variable: ask about pay, pensions, or social benefits

var.name: infqbst
var.labl: Your [pay/pensions/social benefits], which frequency do you know best

qstn.qstnLit: G8a/b/c Thinking about your usual pay/pensions/social benefits, which one do you know best?
qstn.postQTxt: Please choose your answer from this card.

var.notes: INTRODUCTION TO QUESTIONS G8-17: Now some questions on your personal situation. Please remember that all the information you give me will be treated in the strictest confidence. [The following block of questions (G8 to G17) is routed based on the respondent's main source of personal income, as previously reported in F42a (or F40 for one-person households). Questions with the 'a' suffix are asked to respondents receiving wages or salaries, income from self-employment or from farming; questions with the 'b' suffix are asked to respondents receiving pensions; questions with the 'c' suffix are asked to respondents receiving unemployment/redundancy benefit or other social benefits or grants.] [Countries can include any subset of the 3 categories below] NOTE ON ADMINISTRATION OF G8a The set of country-specific categories that are listed in the 'Consultation outcomes' for Justice and Fairness on the ESS9 NC Intranet should be made available to interviewers. In countries where two or more categories are relevant, G8a should be asked to all respondents. In countries where only one category is relevant, G8a should be skipped and the pre-selected frequency of pay should be included at G9a, G11a, G15a and G16a. Iceland: Filter error. For more information see 'Completeness of Study Stored' in the ESS9 Data Documentation Report.

var.name: grspnum
var.labl: What is your usual [weekly/monthly/annual] gross pay

qstn.qstnLit: G9a What is your usual weekly/monthly/annual gross pay before tax and compulsory deductions?
qstn.postQTxt: INTERVIEWER: Use 0 if the respondent does not receive any pay. If the respondent does not have a usual pay, ask them to think of the pay received in a typical week/month/year. TYPE IN AMOUNT [in own currency] OR CODE

var.notes: Germany: Variable has been subject to anonymisation. Iceland: Filter error. For more information see 'Completeness of Study Stored' in the ESS9 Data Documentation Report.

var.name: grsplet
var.labl: Which letter describes your gross pay

qstn.preQTxt: ASK IF DON'T KNOW/REFUSAL AT G9a (G9a = 7777777, 8888888) CARD 57
qstn.qstnLit: G10a Would you be able to tell me which letter describes your gross pay? If you don't know the exact figure, please give an estimate.
qstn.postQTxt: Use the part of the card that you know best: weekly, monthly or annual pay.

var.notes: Czechia: Instrument error. For more information see 'Completeness of Study Stored' in the ESS9 Data Documentation Report.

var.name: netinum
var.labl: Your usual [weekly/monthly/annual] net [pay/pensions/social benefits]

qstn.qstnLit: G11a/b/c And what is your usual weekly/monthly/annual net pay/pensions/social benefits after tax and compulsory deductions?
qstn.postQTxt: INTERVIEWER: Use 0 if the respondent does not receive any pay/pensions/social benefits. If the respondent does not have a usual pay/pensions/social benefits], ask them to think of the pay/pensions/social benefits] received in a typical week/month/year. TYPE IN AMOUNT [in own currency] OR CODE

var.notes: Germany: Variable has been subject to anonymisation. Iceland: Filter error. For more information see 'Completeness of Study Stored' in the ESS9 Data Documentation Report.

var.name: netilet
var.labl: Which letter describes your net [pay/pensions/social benefits]

qstn.preQTxt: ASK IF DON'T KNOW/REFUSAL AT G11a/b/c (IF G11a/b/c = 7777777, 8888888) CARD 58/61/64
qstn.qstnLit: G12a/b/c Would you be able to tell me which letter describes your net pay/pensions/social benefits? If you don't know the exact figure, please give an estimate.
qstn.postQTxt: Use the part of the card that you know best: weekly, monthly or annual income.

var.notes: Croatia: Instrument error. Iceland: Filter error. For more information see 'Completeness of Study Stored' in the ESS9 Data Documentation Report.

var.name: grspfr
var.labl: Would you say your gross pay is unfairly low, fair, or unfairly high

qstn.preQTxt: ASK IF THE GROSS PAY REPORTED AT G9a IS GREATER THAN 0, OR IF THE RESPONDENT ANSWERED DON'T KNOW/REFUSAL AT G9a (IF G9a > 0 OR G9a = 7777777, 8888888) CARD 59
qstn.qstnLit: G13a Would you say your gross pay is unfairly low, fair, or unfairly high?
qstn.postQTxt: If you think your pay is unfairly low, please choose a number from the left-hand side (-4 to -1). If you think your pay is fair, please choose 0. If you think your pay is unfairly high, please choose a number from the right-hand side (1 to 4).

var.name: netifr
var.labl: Your net [pay/pensions/social benefits] is unfairly low, fair, or unfairly high

qstn.preQTxt: ASK IF THE NET PAY/PENSIONS/SOCIAL BENEFITS REPORTED AT G11a/b/c IS GREATER THAN 0, OR IF THE RESPONDENT ANSWERED DON'T KNOW/REFUSAL AT G11a/b/c (IF G11a/b/c > 0 OR G11a/b/c = 7777777, 8888888) STILL CARD 59/62/65
qstn.qstnLit: G14a/b/c Would you say your net pay/pensions/social benefits is unfairly low, fair, or unfairly high?
qstn.postQTxt: INTERVIEWER: If the respondent needs additional instructions on how to use the scale, please say: If you think your pay is unfairly low, please choose a number from the left-hand side (-4 to -1). If you think your pay is fair, please choose 0. If you think your pay is unfairly high, please choose a number from the right-hand side (1 to 4).

var.notes: Iceland: Filter error. For more information see 'Completeness of Study Stored' in the ESS9 Data Documentation Report.

var.name: frlgrsp
var.labl: Fair level of [weekly/monthly/annual] gross pay for you

qstn.preQTxt: ASK IF GROSS PAY NOT REPORTED AS FAIR AT G13a, INCLUDING IF RESPONDENT ANSWERED DON'T KNOW/REFUSAL AT G13a (G13a > 0 OR G13a < 0 OR G13a = 7, 8)
qstn.qstnLit: G15a In your opinion, what would be a fair level of weekly/monthly/annual gross pay for you?
qstn.postQTxt: TYPE IN AMOUNT [in own currency] OR CODE

var.universe: If G13a > 0 or G13a < 0 or code 7, 8 at G13a
var.notes: Slovakia: Filter error. For more information see 'Completeness of Study Stored' in the ESS9 Data Documentation Report.

var.name: frlneti
var.labl: Fair level of [weekly/monthly/annual] net [pay/pensions/social benefits] for you

qstn.preQTxt: ASK IF NET PAY/PENSIONS/SOCIAL BENEFITS NOT REPORTED AS FAIR AT G14a/b/c, INCLUDING IF RESPONDENT ANSWERED DON'T KNOW/REFUSAL AT G14a/b/c (G14a/b/c > 0 OR G14a/b/c < 0 OR G14a/b/c = 7, 8)
qstn.qstnLit: G16a/b/c In your opinion, what would be a fair level of weekly/monthly/annual net pay/pensions/social benefits for you?
qstn.postQTxt: TYPE IN AMOUNT [in own currency] OR CODE

var.universe: If G14a/b/c > 0 or G14a/b/c < 0 or code 7, 8 at G14a/b/c
var.notes: Iceland, Serbia: Filter error. For more information see 'Completeness of Study Stored' in the ESS9 Data Documentation Report.

var.name: occinfr
var.labl: Net [pay/pensions/social benefits] of people same occupation as you in country, how fair

qstn.qstnLit: G17a/b/c In general, do you think the pay of people who work in the same occupation as you in [country] is unfairly low, fair, or unfairly high? In general, do you think the incomes from pensions of people who worked in the same occupation as you in [country] are unfairly low, fair, or unfairly high? In general, do you think the incomes from social benefits of people receiving social benefits in [country] are unfairly low, fair, or unfairly high?
qstn.postQTxt: INTERVIEWER: If the respondent needs additional instructions on how to use the scale, please say: If you think your pay is unfairly low, please choose a number from the left-hand side (-4 to -1). If you think your pay is fair, please choose 0. If you think your pay is unfairly high, please choose a number from the right-hand side (1 to 4).

var.name: topinfr
var.labl: Top 10% full-time employees in country, earning more than [amount], how fair

qstn.preQTxt: ASK ALL Figures on incomes show that the top 10% of employees in [country] earn more than [amount per month or per year] and the bottom 10% of employees earn less than [amount per month or per year]. These figures are based on income before tax and compulsory deductions for full-time employees. I’m now going to ask you how fair incomes for each of these groups are. CARD 65
qstn.qstnLit: G18 Please think about the top 10% of employees working full-time in [country], earning more than [amount per month or per year]. In your opinion, are these incomes unfairly low, fair, or unfairly high? Please think generally about people earning this level of incomes.
qstn.postQTxt: INTERVEIWER: If the respondent needs additional instructions on how to use the scale, please say: If you think these incomes are unfairly low, please choose a number from the left-hand side. If you think these incomes are fair, please choose 0. If you think these incomes are unfairly high, please choose a number from the right-hand side.

var.name: btminfr
var.labl: Bottom 10% full-time employees in country, earning less than [amount], how fair

qstn.qstnLit: G19 And now please think about the bottom 10% of employees working full-time in [country], earning less than [amount per month or per year]. In your opinion, are these incomes unfairly low, fair, or unfairly high? Please think generally about people earning this level of incomes.
qstn.postQTxt: INTERVEIWER: If the respondent needs additional instructions on how to use the scale, please say: If you think these incomes are unfairly low, please choose a number from the left-hand side. If you think these incomes are fair, please choose 0. If you think these incomes are unfairly high, please choose a number from the right-hand side.

var.name: wltdffr
var.labl: Differences in wealth in country, how fair

qstn.qstnLit: G20 In your opinion, are differences in wealth in [country] unfairly small, fair, or unfairly large?
qstn.postQTxt: INTERVIEWER: If you think these differences are unfairly small, please choose a number from the left-hand side. If you think these differences are fair, please choose 0. If you think these differences are unfairly large, please choose a number from the right-hand side.

var.name: recskil
var.labl: Influence decision to recruit in country: person's knowledge and skills

qstn.preQTxt: Now I would like to ask you about how employers select amongst job applicants in [country]. Many factors can influence whether a person is recruited or not recruited for a job. We are going to ask you how much influence each factor has. There are no right or wrong answers, so please just tell me what you think. CARD 67
qstn.qstnLit: G21-25 In your opinion, how much influence does each of the following factors have on the decision to recruit or not to recruit a person for a job in [country]? The person's knowledge and skills.

var.name: recexp
var.labl: Influence decision to recruit in country: person's on-the-job experience

qstn.preQTxt: Now I would like to ask you about how employers select amongst job applicants in [country]. Many factors can influence whether a person is recruited or not recruited for a job. We are going to ask you how much influence each factor has. There are no right or wrong answers, so please just tell me what you think. CARD 67
qstn.qstnLit: G21-25 In your opinion, how much influence does each of the following factors have on the decision to recruit or not to recruit a person for a job in [country]? The person's on-the-job experience.

var.name: recknow
var.labl: Influence decision to recruit in country: person knows someone in organisation

qstn.preQTxt: Now I would like to ask you about how employers select amongst job applicants in [country]. Many factors can influence whether a person is recruited or not recruited for a job. We are going to ask you how much influence each factor has. There are no right or wrong answers, so please just tell me what you think. CARD 67
qstn.qstnLit: G21-25 In your opinion, how much influence does each of the following factors have on the decision to recruit or not to recruit a person for a job in [country]? Whether the person knows someone in the organisation.

var.name: recimg
var.labl: Influence decision to recruit in country: person has immigrant background

qstn.preQTxt: Now I would like to ask you about how employers select amongst job applicants in [country]. Many factors can influence whether a person is recruited or not recruited for a job. We are going to ask you how much influence each factor has. There are no right or wrong answers, so please just tell me what you think. CARD 67
qstn.qstnLit: G21-25 In your opinion, how much influence does each of the following factors have on the decision to recruit or not to recruit a person for a job in [country]? Whether the person has an immigrant background.

var.name: recgndr
var.labl: Influence decision to recruit in country: person's gender

qstn.preQTxt: Now I would like to ask you about how employers select amongst job applicants in [country]. Many factors can influence whether a person is recruited or not recruited for a job. We are going to ask you how much influence each factor has. There are no right or wrong answers, so please just tell me what you think. CARD 67
qstn.qstnLit: G21-25 In your opinion, how much influence does each of the following factors have on the decision to recruit or not to recruit a person for a job in [country]? The person's gender.

var.name: sofrdst
var.labl: Society fair when income and wealth is equally distributed

qstn.preQTxt: Now some questions about society in general. CARD 68
qstn.qstnLit: G26-32 There are many different views as to what makes a society fair or unfair. How much do you agree or disagree with each of the following statements? A society is fair when income and wealth are equally distributed among all people.

var.name: sofrwrk
var.labl: Society fair when hard-working people earn more than others

qstn.preQTxt: Now some questions about society in general. CARD 68
qstn.qstnLit: G26-32 There are many different views as to what makes a society fair or unfair. How much do you agree or disagree with each of the following statements? A society is fair when hard-working people earn more than others.

var.name: sofrpr
var.labl: Society fair when takes care of poor and in need, regardless of what give back

qstn.preQTxt: Now some questions about society in general. CARD 68
qstn.qstnLit: G26-32 There are many different views as to what makes a society fair or unfair. How much do you agree or disagree with each of the following statements? A society is fair when it takes care of those who are poor and in need regardless of what they give back to society.

var.name: sofrprv
var.labl: Society fair when people from families with high social status enjoy privileges

qstn.preQTxt: Now some questions about society in general. CARD 68
qstn.qstnLit: G26-32 There are many different views as to what makes a society fair or unfair. How much do you agree or disagree with each of the following statements? A society is fair when people from families with high social status enjoy privileges in their lives.

var.name: ppldsrv
var.labl: By and large, people get what they deserve

qstn.preQTxt: Now some questions about society in general. CARD 68
qstn.qstnLit: G26-32 There are many different views as to what makes a society fair or unfair. How much do you agree or disagree with each of the following statements? I think that, by and large, people get what they deserve.

var.name: jstprev
var.labl: Confident that justice always prevails over injustice

qstn.preQTxt: Now some questions about society in general. CARD 68
qstn.qstnLit: G26-32 There are many different views as to what makes a society fair or unfair. How much do you agree or disagree with each of the following statements? I am confident that justice always prevails over injustice.

var.name: pcmpinj
var.labl: Convinced that in the long run people compensated for injustices

qstn.preQTxt: Now some questions about society in general. CARD 68
qstn.qstnLit: G26-32 There are many different views as to what makes a society fair or unfair. How much do you agree or disagree with each of the following statements? I am convinced that in the long run people will be compensated for injustices.

var.name: ipcrtiv
var.labl: Important to think new ideas and being creative

qstn.qstnLit: Ha-u Now I will briefly describe some people. Please listen to each description and tell me how much each person is or is not like you. Use this card for your answer. Thinking up new ideas and being creative is important to her/him. She/he likes to do things in her/his own original way.

var.notes: Hungary, Ireland, Poland, Serbia and the United Kingdom: Quality issues. For more information see 'Completeness of Study Stored' in the ESS9 Data Documentation Report.

var.name: imprich
var.labl: Important to be rich, have money and expensive things

qstn.qstnLit: Ha-u Now I will briefly describe some people. Please listen to each description and tell me how much each person is or is not like you. Use this card for your answer. It is important to her/him to be rich. She/he wants to have a lot of money and expensive things.

var.notes: Hungary, Ireland, Poland, Serbia and the United Kingdom: Quality issues. For more information see 'Completeness of Study Stored' in the ESS9 Data Documentation Report.

var.name: ipeqopt
var.labl: Important that people are treated equally and have equal opportunities

qstn.qstnLit: Ha-u Now I will briefly describe some people. Please listen to each description and tell me how much each person is or is not like you. Use this card for your answer. She/he thinks it is important that every person in the world should be treated equally. She/he believes everyone should have equal opportunities in life.

var.notes: Hungary, Ireland, Poland, Serbia and the United Kingdom: Quality issues. For more information see 'Completeness of Study Stored' in the ESS9 Data Documentation Report.

var.name: ipshabt
var.labl: Important to show abilities and be admired

qstn.qstnLit: Ha-u Now I will briefly describe some people. Please listen to each description and tell me how much each person is or is not like you. Use this card for your answer. It's important to her/him to show her/his abilities. She/he wants people to admire what she/he does.

var.notes: Hungary, Ireland, Poland, Serbia and the United Kingdom: Quality issues. For more information see 'Completeness of Study Stored' in the ESS9 Data Documentation Report.

var.name: impsafe
var.labl: Important to live in secure and safe surroundings

qstn.qstnLit: Ha-u Now I will briefly describe some people. Please listen to each description and tell me how much each person is or is not like you. Use this card for your answer. It is important to her/him to live in secure surroundings. She/he avoids anything that might endanger her/his safety.

var.notes: Hungary, Ireland, Poland, Serbia and the United Kingdom: Quality issues. For more information see 'Completeness of Study Stored' in the ESS9 Data Documentation Report.

var.name: impdiff
var.labl: Important to try new and different things in life

qstn.qstnLit: Ha-u Now I will briefly describe some people. Please listen to each description and tell me how much each person is or is not like you. Use this card for your answer. She/he likes surprises and is always looking for new things to do. She/he thinks it is important to do lots of different things in life.

var.notes: Hungary, Ireland, Poland, Serbia and the United Kingdom: Quality issues. For more information see 'Completeness of Study Stored' in the ESS9 Data Documentation Report.

var.name: ipfrule
var.labl: Important to do what is told and follow rules

qstn.qstnLit: Ha-u Now I will briefly describe some people. Please listen to each description and tell me how much each person is or is not like you. Use this card for your answer. She/he believes that people should do what they're told. She/he thinks people should follow rules at all times, even when no-one is watching.

var.notes: Hungary, Ireland, Poland, Serbia and the United Kingdom: Quality issues. For more information see 'Completeness of Study Stored' in the ESS9 Data Documentation Report.

var.name: ipudrst
var.labl: Important to understand different people

qstn.qstnLit: Ha-u Now I will briefly describe some people. Please listen to each description and tell me how much each person is or is not like you. Use this card for your answer. It is important to her/him to listen to people who are different from her/him. Even when she/he disagrees with them, she/he still wants to understand them.

var.notes: Hungary, Ireland, Poland, Serbia and the United Kingdom: Quality issues. For more information see 'Completeness of Study Stored' in the ESS9 Data Documentation Report.

var.name: ipmodst
var.labl: Important to be humble and modest, not draw attention

qstn.qstnLit: Ha-u Now I will briefly describe some people. Please listen to each description and tell me how much each person is or is not like you. Use this card for your answer. It is important to her/him to be humble and modest. She/he tries not to draw attention to herself/himself.

var.notes: Hungary, Ireland, Poland, Serbia and the United Kingdom: Quality issues. For more information see 'Completeness of Study Stored' in the ESS9 Data Documentation Report.

var.name: ipgdtim
var.labl: Important to have a good time

qstn.qstnLit: Ha-u Now I will briefly describe some people. Please listen to each description and tell me how much each person is or is not like you. Use this card for your answer. Having a good time is important to her/him. She/he likes to 'spoil' herself/himself.

var.notes: Hungary, Ireland, Poland, Serbia and the United Kingdom: Quality issues. For more information see 'Completeness of Study Stored' in the ESS9 Data Documentation Report.

var.name: impfree
var.labl: Important to make own decisions and be free

qstn.qstnLit: Ha-u Now I will briefly describe some people. Please listen to each description and tell me how much each person is or is not like you. Use this card for your answer. It is important to her/him to make her/his own decisions about what she/he does. She/he likes to be free and not depend on others.

var.notes: Hungary, Ireland, Poland, Serbia and the United Kingdom: Quality issues. For more information see 'Completeness of Study Stored' in the ESS9 Data Documentation Report.

var.name: iphlppl
var.labl: Important to help people and care for others well-being

qstn.qstnLit: Ha-u Now I will briefly describe some people. Please listen to each description and tell me how much each person is or is not like you. Use this card for your answer. It's very important to her/him to help the people around her/him. She/he wants to care for their well-being.

var.notes: Hungary, Ireland, Poland, Serbia and the United Kingdom: Quality issues. For more information see 'Completeness of Study Stored' in the ESS9 Data Documentation Report.

var.name: ipsuces
var.labl: Important to be successful and that people recognise achievements

qstn.qstnLit: Ha-u Now I will briefly describe some people. Please listen to each description and tell me how much each person is or is not like you. Use this card for your answer. Being very successful is important to her/him. She/he hopes people will recognise her/his achievements.

var.notes: Hungary, Ireland, Poland, Serbia and the United Kingdom: Quality issues. For more information see 'Completeness of Study Stored' in the ESS9 Data Documentation Report.

var.name: ipstrgv
var.labl: Important that government is strong and ensures safety

qstn.qstnLit: Ha-u Now I will briefly describe some people. Please listen to each description and tell me how much each person is or is not like you. Use this card for your answer. It is important to her/him that the government ensures her/his safety against all threats. She/he wants the state to be strong so it can defend its citizens.

var.notes: Hungary, Ireland, Poland, Serbia and the United Kingdom: Quality issues. For more information see 'Completeness of Study Stored' in the ESS9 Data Documentation Report.

var.name: ipadvnt
var.labl: Important to seek adventures and have an exciting life

qstn.qstnLit: Ha-u Now I will briefly describe some people. Please listen to each description and tell me how much each person is or is not like you. Use this card for your answer. She/he looks for adventures and likes to take risks. She/he wants to have an exciting life.

var.notes: Hungary, Ireland, Poland, Serbia and the United Kingdom: Quality issues. For more information see 'Completeness of Study Stored' in the ESS9 Data Documentation Report.

var.name: ipbhprp
var.labl: Important to behave properly

qstn.qstnLit: Ha-u Now I will briefly describe some people. Please listen to each description and tell me how much each person is or is not like you. Use this card for your answer. It is important to her/him always to behave properly. She/he wants to avoid doing anything people would say is wrong.

var.notes: Hungary, Ireland, Poland, Serbia and the United Kingdom: Quality issues. For more information see 'Completeness of Study Stored' in the ESS9 Data Documentation Report.

var.name: iprspot
var.labl: Important to get respect from others

qstn.qstnLit: Ha-u Now I will briefly describe some people. Please listen to each description and tell me how much each person is or is not like you. Use this card for your answer. It is important to her/him to get respect from others. She/he wants people to do what she/he says.

var.notes: Hungary, Ireland, Poland, Serbia and the United Kingdom: Quality issues. For more information see 'Completeness of Study Stored' in the ESS9 Data Documentation Report.

var.name: iplylfr
var.labl: Important to be loyal to friends and devote to people close

qstn.qstnLit: Ha-u Now I will briefly describe some people. Please listen to each description and tell me how much each person is or is not like you. Use this card for your answer. It is important to her/him to be loyal to her/his friends. She/he wants to devote herself/himself to people close to her/him.

var.notes: Hungary, Ireland, Poland, Serbia and the United Kingdom: Quality issues. For more information see 'Completeness of Study Stored' in the ESS9 Data Documentation Report.

var.name: impenv
var.labl: Important to care for nature and environment

qstn.qstnLit: Ha-u Now I will briefly describe some people. Please listen to each description and tell me how much each person is or is not like you. Use this card for your answer. She/he strongly believes that people should care for nature. Looking after the environment is important to her/him.

var.notes: Hungary, Ireland, Poland, Serbia and the United Kingdom: Quality issues. For more information see 'Completeness of Study Stored' in the ESS9 Data Documentation Report.

var.name: imptrad
var.labl: Important to follow traditions and customs

qstn.qstnLit: Ha-u Now I will briefly describe some people. Please listen to each description and tell me how much each person is or is not like you. Use this card for your answer. Tradition is important to her/him. She/he tries to follow the customs handed down by her/his religion or her/his family.

var.notes: Hungary, Ireland, Poland, Serbia and the United Kingdom: Quality issues. For more information see 'Completeness of Study Stored' in the ESS9 Data Documentation Report.

var.name: impfun
var.labl: Important to seek fun and things that give pleasure

qstn.qstnLit: Ha-u Now I will briefly describe some people. Please listen to each description and tell me how much each person is or is not like you. Use this card for your answer. She/he seeks every chance she/he can to have fun. It is important to her/him to do things that give her/him pleasure.

var.notes: Hungary, Ireland, Poland, Serbia and the United Kingdom: Quality issues. For more information see 'Completeness of Study Stored' in the ESS9 Data Documentation Report.

var.name: region
var.labl: Region

qstn.qstnLit: R Region

var.notes: Common region variable for all partcipating countries, with NUTS units for countries included in the Nomenclature of Territorial Units for Statistics (NUTS), and nationally defined units for others. For documentation of country-wise categories, please see item 40 in the ESS9-2018 Documentation Report or in Appendix A6. Slovenia: Variable has been subject to anonymisation. Hungary and Ireland: Variable harmonisation. For more information see 'Completeness of Study Stored' in the ESS9 Data Documentation Report.
